ITAL 470 Naples, Rome, Venice
(A. Castaldo / TTh 1:00-2:15)
Content: This class will delve into the cultural history of three millenary Italian cities, Naples, Rome, and Venice, which have played a key role in the history and collective imagination of Italian and European culture. We will explore each city through the lens of literature, cinema/TV, and art history while focusing on topics such as collective and micro history, fictional narratives (from novels to tv shows), notable personalities, meaningful historical events, and cultural manifestations, from traditional - often centuries-old - popular celebrations to modern-day film and art festivals. This class will rely on geographic visualization tools, from Google Maps Street View to historical virtual maps, which will allow us to explore the urban environments and to situate in their real context the cultural objects we will analyze. Class taught in Italian.
